posts.post_content: This sure ain't [Goblin Piledriver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Piledriver). However, it's still a pretty interesting card, a very strong effect in a thinly supported tribe. Any (completely insane) dwarf deck could use something like this.

Posted By: Auteur (8/31/2010 11:59:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: In a tribal dwarf deck such as mine, the Bloodboiler goes fairly well with [Dwarven Warriors](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dwarven Warriors) or [Dwarven Nomad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dwarven Nomad) and a pile of the ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) cost dwarves to make a chunky unblockable attacker. Sure, a dwarf deck is a one-trick pony, but for a tribe that has about 2 decent cards, it's not a bad combo. If you have a [Dwarven Thaumaturgist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dwarven Thaumaturgist), you can even make a chunky little blocker.
posts.html:
In a tribal dwarf deck such as mine, the Bloodboiler goes fairly well with Dwarven Warriors or Dwarven Nomad and a pile of the cost dwarves to make a chunky unblockable attacker. Sure, a dwarf deck is a one-trick pony, but for a tribe that has about 2 decent cards, it's not a bad combo. If you have a Dwarven Thaumaturgist, you can even make a chunky little blocker.
